revised_title: Exploring the Mechanism and Properties of Feedback Spikes in Turtle Cones
tldr: The authors conducted experiments on turtle cones and discovered that feedback spikes are due to a regenerative increase in cone calcium conductance. They found that these spikes are facilitated by Sr2+ or Ba2+ media and can be induced in all turtle cones, suggesting that every cone receives a feedback input from L-horizontal cells. This research provides insight into the mechanism and properties of feedback spikes in the visual processing of turtle cones.
